intro: Pseudosantalum umbelliferum, commonly known as the silky oak, is a deciduous tree native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its feathery, umbrella-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its bark is smooth and grayish, often peeling in thin layers, and it can grow up to 30 meters tall in suitable conditions. The tree is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, sandy soils.
